headline: Value season offers compelling wildlife with significant savings
summary: Peak season (June-October in most regions) offers optimal conditions but 30-50% higher prices. Value/shoulder seasons provide excellent wildlife viewing with 20-40% savings, fewer crowds, and photogenic landscapes. The trade-off involves weather unpredictability and some road accessibility challenges. For flexible travelers, value season often delivers better overall experience.

assumptions.text: Peak season rates are 30-50% higher than shoulder/value season.
Wildlife is present year-round; concentration differs but viewing quality remains good.
Peak season crowds can significantly impact exclusive sighting experiences.

change_conditions: If seeing the Great Migration is your primary goal, peak timing matters more.
If you have fixed dates with no flexibility, compare actual pricing.
If traveling with young children, drier peak season may be more comfortable.
If photography is priority, shoulder season light is often superior.
